page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: MY ELDERLY NEIGHBOUR HAS BEEN LIVING IN CWMGWRACH FOR SIXTY YEARS.SHE STARTED WORK AT FOURTEEN AS A DOMESTIC SERVANT. LIFE THEN WAS A LOT DIFFERENT FROM TODAY. {MOST PEOPLE LIVED IN TERRACED HOUSES {WHICH HAD NO BATHROOM AND WHERE THE {TOILET WAS AT THE BOTTOM OF THE {GARDEN.PEOPLE THEN HAD LARGE FAMILIES {OF EIGHT OR NINE CHILDREN AND SOME {DIED WHEN THEY WERE VERY YOUNG. SHE {DIDN'T HAVE A LOT OF POCKET MONEY.FOR {TWO BOB(10P)SHE COULD BUY 4OZS OF {SWEETS,GO TO SEE CHARLIE CHAPLIN IN {ONE OF HIS FUNNY FILMS AND STILL HAVE {CHANGE. ALL THE WASHING WAS DONE BY HAND USING A BAR OF SOAP AND A SCRUBBING BOARD WHICH WAS PLACED IN A TUB OF HOT WATER.THE WATER WAS HEATED IN A BOILER PLACED ON A COAL FIRE.THE COOKING WAS ALSO DONE ON A COAL FIRE.
